p: Roots: As shown in Table 1, sesquiterpenes (75.3%), monoterpenes (18.2%), and methyl ketones (6.6%) were dominant in the essential oil isolated from Z. psammophilum roots. The main components were found to be β-caryophyllene (21.8%), thymol (15.7%), α-humulene (13.6%), elemol (5.2%), α-copaene (5.7%), β-selinene (4.9%), caryophyllene oxide (4.7%), δ-cadinene (4.5%), and cyclosativene (4.2%).
